p: An initial screen was performed on 109 extracts from the 21 plant species found in the QNPL to select the most active extracts. All extracts which had higher than 90% inhibition on P. gingivalis at 256 μg/mL were defined as hits. The hits from this screen, 38 extracts from 17 plants, were chosen for a second screening at 64 μg/mL. The second screen yielded 21 extracts from 11 plants that were considered as hits (>90% inhibition) and were further selected for MIC assays by dose-response testing ( S1 Fig). MIC values ranged from 8–128 μg/mL. Pistacia lentiscus fruits exhibited the best MIC with a value of 8 μg/mL, followed by Zanthoxylum armatum fruits/seeds with an MIC of 16 μg/mL. Ten plant extracts had an MIC of 32 μg/mL, and eight had an MIC of 64 μg/mL ( Table 1).
